|rad1chip2 = Marvell;88W8060; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = Gemtek WMIM-211N V02 |rad2modif = Mini PCI (long) |wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Marvell;88W8363; |rad2chip2 = Marvell;88W8060; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== OEM Gemtek WRTM-190N (WRTM-190N_V01, 190-C04-5500R) One wireless module is a Gemtek WMIM-211N. The default SSID is the wireless interface MAC address followed by '''_A''' and '''_G'''. An example set would be '''0016016F148A_A''' and '''0016016F148A_G'''. The power adapter included with the device is a '''Buffalo''' / '''JET''' UIA324-12 (12V, 2A). ==Links of Interest== [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/29885-buffalo-nfiniti-dual-band-router-double-your-draft-11n-fun Reviewed on SmallNetBuilder] (specs, FCC photos)
[http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16833162014 On Newegg] (reviews) [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buffalo_AirStation Listed on the Buffalo AirStation page on Wikipedia] [[Category:English Documentation]]
